output_list.reason: The mintToken function allows an integer overflow, where totalSupply is increased by mintedAmount without a check, allowing the owner to mint an arbitrary large amount of tokens.
The transferFrom function has a wrong logic where it returns false if the balances or allowances are insufficient, instead of requiring sufficient funds and allowances.
The ToOwner function has no access control, allowing any user to claim ownership and funds.
The mintToken function allows the owner to mint an arbitrary large amount of tokens, devaluing the token.
The claimThrone function has an integer overflow vulnerability where the balance is updated before the transfer, allowing a user to DOS the contract.
